metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: The HAVING clause was added to SQL because the WHERE keyword cannot be used with aggregate functions.
content.html: The HAVING clause was added to SQL because the WHERE keyword cannot be used with aggregate functions.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT column_name(s)
  FROM table_name
  WHERE condition
  GROUP BY column_name(s)HAVING conditionORDER BY 
  column_name(s);

content.code:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
GROUP BY column_name(s)HAVING conditionORDER BY
column_name(s);

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT column_name(s)
 FROM table_name
 WHERE condition
 GROUP BY column_name(s)HAVING conditionORDER BY 
  column_name(s);

content.code_html:
SELECT column_name(s)
FROM table_name
WHERE condition
GROUP BY column_name(s)
HAVING condition
ORDER BY column_name(s);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT column_name(s)
  FROM table_name
  WHERE condition
  GROUP BY column_name(s)HAVING conditionORDER BY 
  column_name(s);

content.text: The following SQL statement lists the number of customers in each country. Only include countries with more than 5 customers:
content.html: The following SQL statement lists the number of customers in each country. Only include countries with more than 5 customers:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), CountryFROM CustomersGROUP BY Country
  HAVING COUNT(CustomerID) > 5;

content.code:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), CountryFROM CustomersGROUP BY Country
HAVING COUNT(CustomerID) > 5;

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), CountryFROM CustomersGROUP BY Country
 HAVING COUNT(CustomerID) > 5;

content.code_html:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), Country
FROM Customers
GROUP BY Country
HAVING COUNT(CustomerID) > 5;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), CountryFROM CustomersGROUP BY Country
  HAVING COUNT(CustomerID) > 5;

content.text: The following SQL statement lists the number of customers in each country, sorted high to low (Only include countries with more than 5 customers):
content.html: The following SQL statement lists the number of customers in each country, sorted high to low (Only include countries with more than 5 customers):

content.code_html:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), Country
FROM Customers
GROUP BY Country
HAVING COUNT(CustomerID) > 5
ORDER BY COUNT(CustomerID) DESC;

content.text: The following SQL statement lists the employees that have registered more than 10 orders:
content.html: The following SQL statement lists the employees that have registered more than 10 orders:

content.code_html:
SELECT Employees.LastName, COUNT(Orders.OrderID) AS NumberOfOrders
FROM (Orders
INNER JOIN Employees ON Orders.EmployeeID = Employees.EmployeeID)
GROUP BY LastName
HAVING COUNT(Orders.OrderID) > 10;

content.text: The following SQL statement lists if the employees "Davolio" or "Fuller" have registered more than 25 orders:
content.html: The following SQL statement lists if the employees "Davolio" or "Fuller" have registered more than 25 orders:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
SELECT Employees.LastName, COUNT(Orders.OrderID) AS NumberOfOrdersFROM Orders
  INNER JOIN Employees ON Orders.EmployeeID = Employees.EmployeeID
  WHERE LastName = 'Davolio' OR LastName = 'Fuller'GROUP BY LastNameHAVING 
  COUNT(Orders.OrderID) > 25;

content.code:
SELECT Employees.LastName, COUNT(Orders.OrderID) AS NumberOfOrdersFROM Orders
INNER JOIN Employees ON Orders.EmployeeID = Employees.EmployeeID
WHERE LastName = 'Davolio' OR LastName = 'Fuller'GROUP BY LastNameHAVING
COUNT(Orders.OrderID) > 25;

syntax_highlighting.text:
SELECT Employees.LastName, COUNT(Orders.OrderID) AS NumberOfOrdersFROM Orders
 INNER JOIN Employees ON Orders.EmployeeID = Employees.EmployeeID
 WHERE LastName = 'Davolio' OR LastName = 'Fuller'GROUP BY LastNameHAVING 
 COUNT(Orders.OrderID) > 25;

content.code_html:
SELECT Employees.LastName, COUNT(Orders.OrderID) AS NumberOfOrders
FROM Orders
INNER JOIN Employees ON Orders.EmployeeID = Employees.EmployeeID
WHERE LastName = 'Davolio' OR LastName = 'Fuller'
GROUP BY LastName
HAVING COUNT(Orders.OrderID) > 25;

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
SELECT Employees.LastName, COUNT(Orders.OrderID) AS NumberOfOrdersFROM Orders
  INNER JOIN Employees ON Orders.EmployeeID = Employees.EmployeeID
  WHERE LastName = 'Davolio' OR LastName = 'Fuller'GROUP BY LastNameHAVING 
  COUNT(Orders.OrderID) > 25;

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is the primary purpose of the SQL HAVING clause?
content.html: What is the primary purpose of the SQL HAVING clause?

metadata.question: What is the primary purpose of the SQL HAVING clause?

options.text: To filter rows based on a condition before grouping
To filter groups based on an aggregate condition after grouping
To order the result set in ascending or descending order

content.question: What is the primary purpose of the SQL HAVING clause?

options.text: To filter rows based on a condition before grouping
To filter groups based on an aggregate condition after grouping
To order the result set in ascending or descending order
